title: Interpret FE output given unemployment data

content.description: Country <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has the following macroeconomic statistics.
content.question: Real Output (Billions $) Unemployment Rate (%) 110 1 108 2 106 3 104 4 102 5 100 6 98 7 Suppose the current cyclical unemployment rate is <math alttext="2%" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>%</mo></math>, the frictional unemployment rate is <math alttext="4%" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>%</mo></math>, and the structural unemployment rate is <math alttext="1%" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>%</mo></math>. What is the full-employment level of real output?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
